text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I'm Ann
Reardon and today for the teeny weenie

challenge you asked me to make a mini
cheesecake YUM! The first thing we need

to do is make the base so put some
cookies into a bag and then crush them

using a rolling pin. Hitting this with a
rolling pin normally works just fine if

your rolling pin is normal-sized and
heavy but not when it's mini ... let me try

pushing it down instead. That seems to be
working ðŸ˜ƒ Give it a bit of a roll and we

have a little bag of cookie crumbs. Tip
that into your bowl we need all of them

so make sure we get every little last
bit out. Then take your butter and put

that on the cooktop and light it up. I
get lots of questions about this oven

asking does it actually work? Yes it
really does just like an old-fashioned

wood-fired stove, if you light a flame
inside a little metal box it gets hot ðŸ”¥

Pour the melted butter in with the
crumbs and then simply mix those

together and you can use any cookie
flavor that you like for the base of

your cheesecake you don't have to use
plain ones. Tip that into the bottom of a

container lined on the base and the
sides with non-stick baking paper and

then just spread that out. Using the back
of your spoon make sure that's just

level all over and then put the base
into the fridge to chill.

To make the filling we need cream cheese
sugar water gelatine milk and cream. Take

your gelatine and tip it in with the
water give it a little bit of a stir and

then leave that just to absorb that
water into the gelatine. Place the cream

into another bowl and whisk that until
it's lightly whipped. Put your cream

cheese into another bowl. When you're
making a cheesecake it makes it much

easier if you let the cream cheese come
to room temperature first so that it's

softer and it's easier to mix. Put all
your rubbish in the bin and then mix

that cream cheese until it's smooth.
Then add in your milk and you want to

mix that again, you can use an electric
mixer for this or you can do it by hand

just have to keep stirring until that
milk is mixed into the cream cheese.

Place the gelatine in the microwave and
you want to heat that just until the

gelatine is melted ... it will bubble over if
you overheat it so keep an eye on it. Tip

that hot mixture in with the Cheesecake
and mix it up as quickly as you can so

that the gelatine is evenly distributed
all the way through. Add in your whipped

cream and fold that gently through the
Cheesecake mixture to make it aerated

and nice and creamy.
Grab your base out of the fridge and

pour the cheesecake mixture over the
base and see how using this shaped

container is going to give us a nice
tall lovely looking cheesecake. Tap that

on the bench a few times just to level
out that top and then return it to the

fridge for a couple of hours to set.
Once that cheesecake is set pull it on

the sides of the baking paper to get it
out of the container. Then just turn it

upside down and peel the baking paper
off the base and then flip it back the

right way up and put it on to your
platter. Peel the baking paper off from

around the outside and it's time to
decorate our cheesecake. I'm going to put

a chocolate bar on top of mine ... you could
use fruit or Oreos or anything you like

really but chocolate bars make it look a
bit decadent and yummy. Take your knife

and chop the chocolate bar into generous
chunks YUM

look at that ðŸ˜ƒ Caramel oozing out there.
Then carefully add the chunks to the top

of your cheesecake piling them up on top.
Add some warmed cream to the melted

chocolate and stir and stir and stir
some more until you get a beautiful

smooth ganache like this. Take a spoonful
of that ganache and drizzle it over the

top over the chocolate bars letting some
of it ooze down onto the cheesecake mmm.

Cut yourself a slice ... now even though
this is very rich I think you could eat

a whole slice without worrying about the
calories ðŸŽ‚

Click here to subscribe to How To Cook
That, here for more mini baking and here

for full-size desserts. Put all your
requests in the comments below ... make it a great week
and I'll see you on Friday ðŸ’•
